channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-15109] TestDFSIO -read -random doesn't work on file sized 4GB
item.description:
TestDFSIO -read -random throws IllegalArgumentException on 4GB file. The cause is:

private long nextOffset(long current) {
      if(skipSize == 0)
        return rnd.nextInt((int)(fileSize));
      if(skipSize > 0)
        return (current < 0) ? 0 : (current + bufferSize + skipSize);
      // skipSize < 0
      return (current < 0) ? Math.max(0, fileSize - bufferSize) :
                             Math.max(0, current + skipSize);
    }
  }

When filesize exceeds signed int, (int)(filesize) will be negative and cause Random.nextInt throws IllegalArgumentException("n must be positive").
item.summary: TestDFSIO -read -random doesn't work on file sized 4GB

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: zhoutai.zt, Attached patch to address the issue. Tested it locally with 5Gb file for random reads.

Thanks ajayydv.

Another way to generate a bounded random long.

ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextLong(fileSize)
